org.apache.hadoop.ipc

Class DecayRpcScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.ipc.DecayRpcScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DecayRpcSchedulerMXBean, RpcScheduler

    public class DecayRpcScheduler
extends Object
implements RpcScheduler, DecayRpcSchedulerMXBean
    The decay RPC scheduler counts incoming requests in a map, then decays the counts at a fixed time interval. The scheduler is optimized for large periods (on the order of seconds), as it offloads work to the decay sweep.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DecayRpcScheduler.DecayTask
      This TimerTask will call decayCurrentCounts until the scheduler has been garbage collected.
      private static class  DecayRpcScheduler.MetricsProxy
      MetricsProxy is a singleton because we may init multiple schedulers and we want to clean up resources when a new scheduler replaces the old one.

    • Field Detail

      • IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_PERIOD_KEY

        public static final String IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_PERIOD_KEY
        Period controls how many milliseconds between each decay sweep.
        See Also:

      • IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_PERIOD_DEFAULT

        public static final long IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_PERIOD_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_FACTOR_KEY

        public static final String IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_FACTOR_KEY
        Decay factor controls how much each count is suppressed by on each sweep. Valid numbers are > 0 and < 1. Decay factor works in tandem with period to control how long the scheduler remembers an identity.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_FACTOR_DEFAULT

        public static final double IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_FACTOR_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_THRESHOLDS_KEY

        public static final String IPC_CALLQUEUE_DECAYSCHEDULER_THRESHOLDS_KEY
        Thresholds are specified as integer percentages, and specify which usage range each queue will be allocated to. For instance, specifying the list 10, 40, 80 implies 4 queues, with - q3 from 80% up - q2 from 40 up to 80 - q1 from 10 up to 40 - q0 otherwise.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DECAYSCHEDULER_UNKNOWN_IDENTITY

        public static final String DECAYSCHEDULER_UNKNOWN_IDENTITY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public DecayRpcScheduler(int numQueues,
                 String ns,
                 Configuration conf)
        Create a decay scheduler.
        Parameters:
        numQueues - number of queues to schedule for
        ns - config prefix, so that we can configure multiple schedulers in a single instance.
        conf - configuration to use.

      • getDefaultThresholds

        private static double[] getDefaultThresholds(int numQueues)
        Generate default thresholds if user did not specify. Strategy is to halve each time, since queue usage tends to be exponential. So if numQueues is 4, we would generate: double[]{0.125, 0.25, 0.5} which specifies the boundaries between each queue's usage.
        Parameters:
        numQueues - number of queues to compute for
        Returns:
        array of boundaries of length numQueues - 1

      • decayCurrentCounts

        private void decayCurrentCounts()
        Decay the stored counts for each user and clean as necessary. This method should be called periodically in order to keep counts current.

      • recomputeScheduleCache

        private void recomputeScheduleCache()
        Update the scheduleCache to match current conditions in callCounts.

                      throws InterruptedException
        Get the number of occurrences and increment atomically.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the value before incrementation
        Throws:

      • computePriorityLevel

        private int computePriorityLevel(long occurrences)
        Given the number of occurrences, compute a scheduling decision.
        Parameters:
        occurrences - how many occurrences
        Returns:
        scheduling decision from 0 to numQueues - 1

      • cachedOrComputedPriorityLevel

        private int cachedOrComputedPriorityLevel(Object identity)
        Returns the priority level for a given identity by first trying the cache, then computing it.
        Parameters:
        identity - an object responding to toString and hashCode
        Returns:
        integer scheduling decision from 0 to numQueues - 1
